basics.name: Pierre Barbera
basics.label: Researcher (Computational Phylogenetics)
basics.summary: I'm in the final months of my PhD program in Computational Bioinformatics, during which I've implemented and published successful high performance applications that are used on a daily basis in microbial ecology, microbiome, and metagenomic research. I am motivated by wanting to make a positive impact on the world, which currently has me interested in a wide variety of topics such as data analysis and communication, smart contracts, finance, renewable energy, and how to organize society in a more sustainable way.

highlights: Developed, released, and maintained EPA-ng: a HPC software for Phylogenetic Placement
Developed, released, and maintained SCRAPP: a HPC pipeline for diversity quantification
Published several works in field-specific high impact journals
Advised multiple student seminars, as well as master theses
Taught classes in 'Introduction to Bioinformatics for Computer Scientists'
Teaching Assistant at the CoME10 summer school in Crete
work.summary: Member of the Computational Molecular Evolution (CME) group, which focuses on High Performance Computational Phylogenetics. My research focused around applying phylogenetic methods to metagenomic/microbiome data analysis in a High Performance Computing context.
